nav.div: Adirondack Central School District » Community » COVID-19 Information & Updates

div.br:
While the Adirondack Central School District does not have a confirmed case of COVID-19, we are aware of concerns in the community about the spread of this virus.
Regents Exam Update (NYSED - April 7th)
Superintendent's Update Letter (April 3rd)
Child Care Survey for Parents - ​Child care for essential employees
Superintendent's Letter - School Closure Update (March 23rd)
Board of Education Meeting - Notice of Date Change (March 23rd)
Child Care for Health Care Workers and First Responders (March 19th)
Superintendent's Letter - School Closure Information (March 16th)
Jefferson-Lewis BOCES Press Release (March 14th)
Coronavirus Update (March 13th)
Informational letter regarding the Coronavirus (March 6th)
Below are some resources from the state and local health departments and the CDC for your reference:
*Oneida County Health Department: https://ocgov.net/health *New York State Department of Health: https://www.health.ny.gov/ *Center Disease Control (CDC): www.cdc.gov *Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19): https://www.health.ny.gov/diseases/communicable/coronavirus *Prevention, Treatment of Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/about/prevention-treatment.html
